Description: Limestone stela: rough with a rounded top, the surfaces very much pitted and eroded by weathering. The stela bears the remains of an inscription in low relief, beneath which is a figure of a seated woman. The details of the inscription have been considerably obscured by the erosion of the stone.
Findspot: Excavated/Findspot: Tomb of Djer, subsidiary grave
Curator's comments: Bibliography: W. M. F. Petrie, 'Royal Tombs of the Earliest Dynasties' II, pl. XXVI, 53; XXVIII, 53; British Museum, 'Hieroglyphic Texts from Egyptian Stelae, etc'., I (London), pl.2; P. Kaplony, 'Die Inschriften der Ägyptischen Frühzeit I (Wiesbaden, 1963), 184, 579; A. Roveri and F. Tiradritte (eds.), 'Kemet: Alle Sorgenti del Tempo', (Ravenna, 1998), p.232 [197].
Exhibition history: Exhibited: 2003, Apr-Oct, Graz, Eggenberg Palace, 'The Tower of Babel'
